articles.description: In the beginning was the thing, and the thing was against God. So might begin the gospel of American secularism. The sudden flourish of secularism at the time…
articles.notes: Secularism was once an elite conspiract. It was never popular, but was successfully advanced by playing sects off each other and stoking their fears that another sect would come to power and oppress them. Because of this while the founders were able to get secularism enshrined in law they were unable to successfully create secular institutions to rival religion.
